review: Plugged it in and software downloaded. After an hour of figuring it out, I finally got video to cast onto the TV but no sound.  Beware -  ChromeCast.com has terrible troubleshooting.  It was useless.  Help forums were just as useless.  There's no way to contact them for any type of phone or email support or any instructions for no sound troubleshooting.  Complete waste of money unless you can read lips.
author: E. OBD "eclectic tastes"

review: For $30 I thought for sure this would be a piece of crap - but Chromecast is really awesome.  We do not have cable - we only pay $7.99/month for Netflix, and the app is really excellent.  We also tried Hulu out for a little, and that app was great as well.  Today I just discovered I can install an addon to my chrome browser to send whatever I've watching on my PC to my TV - so all the shows that are available for a limited time for free on the Networks website (ahem Walking Dead) - I can watch on my TV instead of hovering over my desk! The quality is surprisingly good - and for free, I have no complaints.
